channel.title: [Help] Books or Learning resources
channel.description:
[center]Hey guys, im on my quest to learn java, but google really has nothing for java compared to all the other languages ive tried, can anybody please give me some links to the downloads of java books etc or some other kind of learning resource for java programming, thank you! :)
[img]http://www.renegades.org/crunchyfrog/images/DSC01905.jpg[/img][/center]

item.title: [Help] Books or Learning resources
item.dc:creator: @Yz85Racer Yz85Racer
item.description:
@Yz85Racer wrote:

[quote=“runescape3dude, post:12, topic:148917”][quote author=Daed link=topic=204182.msg1800283#msg1800283 date=1191541780]
[center]Hey guys, im on my quest to learn java, but google really has nothing for java compared to all the other languages ive tried, can anybody please give me some links to the downloads of java books etc or some other kind of learning resource for java programming, thank you!

[/center]
Download a runescape server and read the class files… Modify them to see what works… Sure it will kill your imagination, but it isnt boring… I managed to get pretty good a coding without reading more than two lines of a java book…
[/quote][/quote]
Wow. Fail.

Read full topic

item.title: [Help] Books or Learning resources
item.dc:creator: @Greeny Greeny
item.description:
@Greeny wrote:

[quote=“runescape3dude, post:12, topic:148917”][quote author=Daed link=topic=204182.msg1800283#msg1800283 date=1191541780]
[center]Hey guys, im on my quest to learn java, but google really has nothing for java compared to all the other languages ive tried, can anybody please give me some links to the downloads of java books etc or some other kind of learning resource for java programming, thank you!

[/center]
Download a runescape server and read the class files… Modify them to see what works… Sure it will kill your imagination, but it isnt boring… I managed to get pretty good a coding without reading more than two lines of a java book…
[/quote][/quote]

Worst advice ever, private servers are terrible coding practice, they have awful, inefficient examples. They follow no correct rules of programming, names, indentations, EVERYTHING about them is terrible. And I advise you runescape3dude to actually read the rest of that book, because no-one gets good at coding from private server sources.

Read full topic

item.title: [Help] Books or Learning resources
item.dc:creator: @Daed Daed
item.description:
@Daed wrote:

“Hallo there im sean greasley, ive said this in all 35 of my videos so you already know my fucking name so what the is the fucking point? OH its good practice to do it isnt!!!” AAHH SUICIDE >.<

Thnaks for the more comments guys, im finding it hell compared to my noob C++ skills still

Read full topic

item.title: [Help] Books or Learning resources
item.dc:creator: @Gotta_Catch_Them_All Gotta Catch Them All
item.description:
@Gotta_Catch_Them_All wrote:

[quote=“Lothy, post:7, topic:148917”][quote author=Daed link=topic=204182.msg1800644#msg1800644 date=1191548594]

Erm, Learn to google and then learn to read stickies:
http://www.moparisthebest.com/smf/index.php/topic,66248.0.html

And here’s some more:
http://java.sun.com/docs/books/tutorial/
http://sean.cruels.net/java/

As I said in future, search around a little more

Good Luck though

I really like these http://sean.cruels.net/java/ Video tutorials, i like learning from videos, the only downside was he went a bit fast for me to follow, he copied and pasted and it ended up blocking my head up i almost exploded so i had to go away and slit my wrsits a few times, but other than that i got to the 6th or 7th lesson okay
[/quote]
I’m not sure how you can possibly stand Sean Greasley Personally, I used Sun’s java tutorials. No silly accents, and no rushing.[/quote]

I’d feel the same way, if he had an Australian accent of course.

Read full topic

item.title: [Help] Books or Learning resources
item.dc:creator: @Nerice Nerice
item.description:
@Nerice wrote:

Suns site is the source for any and all information IMO.

From it alone I have become a profeceint (sp?) java coder (enough to do projects at work as well) as well as learning bytecode, and enough to create my own jvm (no native calls though please).

Its pretty much all open source, and what is not open, some I got by request anyway, some I just decompiled on my own.

100% of my information came from sun.java.com freely. Every now and then I would ask a question on thier forums, and always recieved a helpful reply no matter how difficult the issue was. Ask your questions there well worded though. Although I already knew C++ extremely well…

Read full topic

item.description:

item.title: [Help] Books or Learning resources
item.dc:creator: @Greeny Greeny
item.description:
@Greeny wrote:

Yeah, I once used a “SAMS” it was quite poor, I would recommend the book titles “JAVA - The complete reference” I think it’s on the seventh edition or something now. Really good book for all levels of experience.

That’s if your willing to fork out the cash to buy one, I personally much prefer books to any ‘e’ or internet alternatives.

Read full topic

item.title: [Help] Books or Learning resources
item.dc:creator: @semaphore semaphore
item.description:
@semaphore wrote:

If it is something worth learning, it is something worth ponying up some dough to learn it.

Bookpool is one of the best resources I know for purchasing books online. You get a really good price compared to barnes and noble etc.

The ‘In a Nutshell’ books are good for beginners. I would stay away from anything with the name “SAMS” in large type on the cover. “For Dummies” is another preposition I would stay away from as well.

Good luck.

Read full topic
